segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like he’s about to fall any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and he doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is right there, waiting for a cookie like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how reckless he’s being, balancing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The jar is almost empty, and he’s still stretching for more.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the stool is going to tip, and he’s going to land right in that puddle of water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, like she’s cheering him on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they even realize how dangerous this is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinet doors are wide open, and he’s barely holding on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the plate in his other hand, ready to catch more cookies like it’s a game.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn’t pull the whole shelf down on top of himself.
segments.speaker: PAR
